Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; cream slip; interior glazed black with two bands in added white; exterior: painted decoration consisting of goat (head, beard and part of shoulder remaining) to right; at right, part of undetermined decoration.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 34, no. 41, pl. XVII)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 241, no. 225, pl. 17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0238) (phase 2)
